alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:18PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stennis Space Center, or 12 miles west of Waveland, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pearlington and Stennis Space Center. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 271 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany
